Screen.title: TopScreen
Screen.Label: ---------- Mouse Button 1 click on field to change ----------

Help.Tip: Menu allowing user choice of stored parameter defaults.
Help.Text:
vtrin - PROCESSDEFAULTS
Menu allowing user choice of stored parameter defaults.
 
 Default = SYSTEM
 Allowed = SYSTEM
 Allowed = PROJECT
 Allowed = USER
 SYSTEM defaults are the defaults listed in the CPS documentation.
 
 PROJECT defaults are defaults the user has saved via the Save as Project
 Default button.
 
 USER defaults are defaults the user has saved via the Save as User Default
 button.

Help.Tip: File selection dialogue
Help.Text:
vtrin - SELECT_PATH_VEL
File selection dialogue
 
 Default =
 Allowed =

Help.Tip: Name of a file with velocity data
Help.Text:
vtrin - PATH_VEL
Name of a file with velocity data
 
 Default = NONE
 Allowed = Character
 Any file with velocity information. The file should not be
 in time or depth slice order

Help.Tip: Use this header when scanning trace files for bin info
Help.Text:
vtrin - BIN_HDR_X
Use this header when scanning trace files for bin info
 
 Default = 7
 Allowed = 17
 Allowed = 37
 Vtrin scans segy and cps trace files to figure out if the traces
 fall into a regular bin pattern. It will use bin_hdr_x as the header
 with x bin information

Help.Tip: Use this header when scanning trace files for bin info
Help.Text:
vtrin - BIN_HDR_Y
Use this header when scanning trace files for bin info
 
 Default = 8
 Allowed = 18
 Vtrin scans segy and cps trace files to figure out if the traces
 fall into a regular bin pattern. It will use bin_hdr_y as the header
 with y bin information

Help.Tip: Maximum number of records to output
Help.Text:
vtrin - TR_MAX
Maximum number of records to output
 
 Default = 99999
 Allowed = >0
 The maximum number of records to output to the processing stream

Help.Tip: Skip this many velocity records in the input file
Help.Text:
vtrin - SKIP_INIT
Skip this many velocity records in the input file
 
 Default = 0
 Allowed = >0
 Skip this many velocity records in the input file.

Help.Tip: Controls skip pattern for input records
Help.Text:
vtrin - NUM_DO
Controls skip pattern for input records
 
 Default = 1
 Allowed = >0
 Read num_do records before skipping num_skip record

Help.Tip: Controls skip pattern for input records
Help.Text:
vtrin - NUM_SKIP
Controls skip pattern for input records
 
 Default = 0
 Allowed =
 Read num_do records before skipping num_skip record

Help.Tip: The number of samples in a record of the file path_vel
Help.Text:
vtrin - PV_NDPT
The number of samples in a record of the file path_vel
 
 Default = 1
 Allowed = Integer > 0
 Informative - The number of samples in a path_vel record

Help.Tip: The record origin for the input file path_vel
Help.Text:
vtrin - PV_TSTRT
The record origin for the input file path_vel
 
 Default = 0.
 Allowed =
 Informative - The T or Z origin in a path_vel record

Help.Tip: The record sample rate in the path_vel file
Help.Text:
vtrin - PV_DT
The record sample rate in the path_vel file
 
 Default = 1.
 Allowed = Real
 Informative - The T or Z bin size in a path_vel record

Help.Tip: The classification of path_vel according to modgrid
Help.Text:
vtrin - FILE_TYPE
The classification of path_vel according to modgrid
 
 Default = UNKNOWN
 Allowed = Character
 Informative - The file type according to the modgrid module

Help.Tip: Scale the time-depth axis for the output traces
Help.Text:
vtrin - DEP_SCALE
Scale the time-depth axis for the output traces
 
 Default = 1.0
 Allowed = Real>0
 The output tstrt and dt will be scaled by this factor.
 If the sample rate in the PATH_VEL file is PV_DT then
 the DT global coming out of VTRIN will be DT= PV_DT/DEP_SCALE

Help.Tip: Scale the output velocity trace values
Help.Text:
vtrin - VEL_SCALE
Scale the output velocity trace values
 
 Default = 1.0
 Allowed = Real
  tr(i) = min(vel_clip_max, max(velocity,velocity(i)*vel_cale))

Help.Tip: Clip the output velocity trace values
Help.Text:
vtrin - VEL_CLIP_MIN
Clip the output velocity trace values
 
 Default = 0.0
 Allowed = Real
  tr(i) = min(vel_clip_max, max(velocity,velocity(i)*vel_cale))

Help.Tip: Clip the output velocity trace values
Help.Text:
vtrin - VEL_CLIP_MAX
Clip the output velocity trace values
 
 Default = 25000.0
 Allowed = Real
  tr(i) = min(vel_clip_max, max(velocity,velocity(i)*vel_cale))

Help.Tip: Button that removes this process parameter screen.
Help.Text:
vtrin - CLOSE
Button that removes this process parameter screen.
 
 Default =
 Allowed =
 Appears only on the view-only process parameter screen.

Help.Tip: Button to accept parameter values, run traps and remove screen.
Help.Text:
vtrin - OK
Button to accept parameter values, run traps and remove screen.
 
 Default =
 Allowed =
 Button that accepts parameter values, runs the parameter traps and removes
 the parameter screen.

Help.Tip: Button that accepts parameter values and runs the parameter traps.
Help.Text:
vtrin - APPLY
Button that accepts parameter values and runs the parameter traps.
 
 Default =
 Allowed =
 Button that accepts parameter values and runs the parameter traps but does
 not remove the parameter screen.

Help.Tip: Button to remove the parameter screen without changing parameters.
Help.Text:
vtrin - CANCEL
Button to remove the parameter screen without changing parameters.
 
 Default =
 Allowed =

Help.Tip: Set parameters to their initial value or last applied value.
Help.Text:
vtrin - RESET
Set parameters to their initial value or last applied value.
 
 Default =
 Allowed =
 Button that sets the parameters back to their values when the screen appeared
 or to their last applied value.

Help.Tip: Accept the current parameters and move to the previous process.
Help.Text:
vtrin - PROCESSLISTLEFT
Accept the current parameters and move to the previous process.
 
 Default =
 Allowed =
 Button that allows the user to accept the current parameter values, run the
 parameter traps and move to the previous process in the current workfile.

Help.Tip: Menu of processes in the current workfile and their number.
Help.Text:
vtrin - PROCESSLIST
Menu of processes in the current workfile and their number.
 
 Default =
 Allowed =
 Menu that allows the user to accept the current parameter values, run the
 parameter traps and move to any chosen process in the current workfile.

Help.Tip: Accept the current parameters and move to the next process.
Help.Text:
vtrin - PROCESSLISTRIGHT
Accept the current parameters and move to the next process.
 
 Default =
 Allowed =
 Button that allows the user to accept the current parameter values, run the
 parameter traps and move to the next process in the current workfile.

Help.Tip: Save the current parameter values as Project Defaults.
Help.Text:
vtrin - PROJECTDEFAULT
Save the current parameter values as Project Defaults.
 
 Default =
 Allowed =
 Button that saves the current parameter values as Project Defaults for this
 process.  There will be one set of Project Defaults for a project.

Help.Tip: Save the current parameter values as User Defaults.
Help.Text:
vtrin - USERDEFAULT
Save the current parameter values as User Defaults.
 
 Default =
 Allowed =
 Button that saves the current parameter values as User Defaults for this
 process.  There will be one set of User Defaults for a userid.

Help.Tip: Allows the user to access the pop-up Help Window.
Help.Text:
vtrin - HELP
Allows the user to access the pop-up Help Window.
 
 Default =
 Allowed =
 The Help Window allows access to three kinds of help:  Parameter Help, CPS
 Process Help and Application (CFE) Help.

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
                         C P S   P R O C E S S
 
 Name       : VTRIN
 Category   : IO
 Written    : 2004-01-26   by: R.S.Day
 Revised    : 2006-06-12   by: B. Menger
 Maturity   : production
 Purpose    : Input a velocity file as input traces
 Portability: No known limitations.
 Parallel   : No
 
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
                          GENERAL DESCRIPTION
 
 The user specifies an input file name for a velocity model. VTRIN extracts
 velocity records from the file and feeds them to the processing flow as
 seismic traces one record at a time. The input file can be any format
 recognized by the CPS modgrid primitive.
 
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
                          ADVICE FOR USERS
 
 The input file has to currently be a time or depth ordered file. A file that
 contains depth or time slices is not legitimate.
 
 Do not confuse the line and record number from the path_vel file with survey
 line and shot information. Velocity files normally specify what CPS header
 words are consistent with the records in the file.
 
 Normally the positions of records in the velocity file are set in terms
 of either survey coordinates (ie. xloc,yloc=17,18) or grid coordinates
 (i.e. xgrid,ygrid=7,8) . If the velocity file geometry is set in terms of
 the xgrid,ygrid headers, then the grid transform will be used to set the
 xloc,yloc headers. If xloc,yloc are used in the velocity file, then 7,8
 will be set by vtrin from the grid transform.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
                           REVISION HISTORY
     Date        Author         Description
     ----        ------         -----------
  6. 2006-06-12  B. Menger      Removed Unused Variables.
  5  2005-01-31  R.S.Day        Quit when fatal error detected. Check if
                                headers are properly set.
  4  2004-03-02  R.S.Day        buffer larger chunks of CPSVEL files to reduce
                                overhead of slow ascii reads.
  3  2004-02-16  R.S.Day        Added velocity clip and scale parameters.
  2  2004-02-05  R.S.Day        Added parameter to scale the output DT.
  1  2004-01-26  R.S.Day        Original version.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------
